translation.src: </s> A very important characteristic of the UK constitution , and one which is central to the question of sovereignty , is that it is the Westminster Parliament that is the supreme legal authority in the UK .
translation.tgt: A very important characteristic of the UK constitution , and one which is central to the question of sovereignty , is that it is the Westminster Parliament that is the supreme legal authority in the UK .

translation.src: </s> According to the orthodox school which subscribes to the views of Albert Venn Dicey , the Westminster Parliament is omnicompetent and can pass laws on any subject it likes to regulate the activities of any person , anywhere , even those of aliens outside British territory .
translation.tgt: According to the orthodox school which subscribes to the views of Albert Venn Dicey , the Westminster Parliament is omnicompetent and can pass laws on any subject it likes to regulate the activities of any person , anywhere , even those of aliens outside British territory .

translation.src: </s> In theory , then , the Westminster Parliament could pass a law banning smoking on the streets of Paris .
translation.tgt: In theory , then , the Westminster Parliament could pass a law banning smoking on the streets of Paris .

translation.src: </s> If our Parliament did so , British courts would be obliged to accept Parliament 's decision and pass judgement accordingly .
translation.tgt: If our Parliament did so , British courts would be obliged to accept Parliament 's decision and pass judgement accordingly .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: Parliament <extra_id_1> R: fettered </s> Of course , in practise , as the Radical school ( who believe that the Westminster Parliament is not legislatively supreme ) point out , in this hypothetical situation , the Parisiens would take no notice whatever of the UK Parliament 's legislation ; and <extra_id_0> would in effect be <extra_id_1> .
translation.tgt: Of course , in practise , as the Radical school ( who believe that the Westminster Parliament is not legislatively supreme ) point out , in this hypothetical situation , the Parisiens would take no notice whatever of the UK Parliament 's legislation ; and Parliament would in effect be fettered .

translation.src: </s> Dicey said that as each Parliament is omnipotent , and therefore has the power to make or unmake any law , no Parliament could bind its successors as to the content or manner and form of subsequent legislation .
translation.tgt: Dicey said that as each Parliament is omnipotent , and therefore has the power to make or unmake any law , no Parliament could bind its successors as to the content or manner and form of subsequent legislation .

translation.src: </s> The Radical like to point out that since the passing of the European Communities Act in 1972 , the Westminster Parliament has ceded its sovereignty and supremacy to Europe .
translation.tgt: The Radical like to point out that since the passing of the European Communities Act in 1972 , the Westminster Parliament has ceded its sovereignty and supremacy to Europe .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: thereby </s> The orthodox school retaliate by pointing out that since a Westminster Parliament passed the 1972 Act <extra_id_0> putting the UK into the European Communities , a future Parliament could just as easily repeal this Act , and take us out of Europe again .
translation.tgt: The orthodox school retaliate by pointing out that since a Westminster Parliament passed the 1972 Act thereby putting the UK into the European Communities , a future Parliament could just as easily repeal this Act , and take us out of Europe again .

translation.src: </s> In this case , Britain would have retained her sovereignty and Parliamentary supremacy .
translation.tgt: In this case , Britain would have retained her sovereignty and Parliamentary supremacy .

translation.src: </s> Of course , this whole question is still a subject of fierce debate .
translation.tgt: Of course , this whole question is still a subject of fierce debate .

translation.src: </s> British courts have avoided a head - on clash by finding ambiguity in a domestic statute and resolving that ambiguity so as to give effect to our Community obligations , or by finding that a statute passed prior to the 1972 European Communities Act is repealed by implication by that Act and does not represent the latest intention of the Westminster Parliament or by arguing that subsequent legislation was inadvertant and that the Westminster Parliament could not have intended to come into conflict with community law .
translation.tgt: British courts have avoided a head - on clash by finding ambiguity in a domestic statute and resolving that ambiguity so as to give effect to our Community obligations , or by finding that a statute passed prior to the 1972 European Communities Act is repealed by implication by that Act and does not represent the latest intention of the Westminster Parliament or by arguing that subsequent legislation was inadvertant and that the Westminster Parliament could not have intended to come into conflict with community law .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> R: rule </s> In a recent development , the European Court of Justice <extra_id_0> in the case of R v Secretary of State for Transport ex parte Factortame and others ( 1990 ) that courts in Britain must suspend an Act of the Westminster Parliament where the rights of the citizens guaranteed by European Community law may be at risk .
translation.tgt: In a recent development , the European Court of Justice rule in the case of R v Secretary of State for Transport ex parte Factortame and others ( 1990 ) that courts in Britain must suspend an Act of the Westminster Parliament where the rights of the citizens guaranteed by European Community law may be at risk .

translation.src: </s> This case for the first time said that it is a principle of UK law as influenced by the European Court that our Parliament is not supreme in every circumstance .
translation.tgt: This case for the first time said that it is a principle of UK law as influenced by the European Court that our Parliament is not supreme in every circumstance .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: to </s> It would seem , therefore , that the advent of a single Europe is indeed meaning a loss of sovereignty for Britain , whatever the orthodox school may think <extra_id_0> the contrary .
translation.tgt: It would seem , therefore , that the advent of a single Europe is indeed meaning a loss of sovereignty for Britain , whatever the orthodox school may think to the contrary .

translation.src: </s> There are several reasons why people in the UK might cease to eat beef .
translation.tgt: There are several reasons why people in the UK might cease to eat beef .

translation.src: </s> For example , everyone may suddenly become vegetarian or tastes may alter in such a way that nobody in the UK wants to eat beef .

translation.src: </s> The only plausible reason for people in the UK to cease to eat beef is the disease CJD .
translation.tgt: The only plausible reason for people in the UK to cease to eat beef is the disease CJD .

translation.src: </s> This disease is the human equivalent of ' MAD COW DISEASE ' or BSE .
translation.tgt: This disease is the human equivalent of ' MAD COW DISEASE ' or BSE .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: there </s> In recent years <extra_id_0> has been a huge increase in the number of cases of BSE .

translation.src: </s> This seems to be mainly caused by farming methods 20 years ago .

translation.src: </s> Many animals which ate this feed developed BSE and even more passed it on to their young .
translation.tgt: Many animals which ate this feed developed BSE and even more passed it on to their young .

translation.src: </s> There is a belief among the people of the UK that eating beef is dangerous , as they believe that the BSE can be passed on to humans when they eat beef .
translation.tgt: There is a belief among the people of the UK that eating beef is dangerous , as they believe that the BSE can be passed on to humans when they eat beef .

translation.src: </s> There is no scientific evidence at present to suggest that this is the case .
translation.tgt: There is no scientific evidence at present to suggest that this is the case .

translation.src: </s> However , cases of CJD and BSE have been widely documented in the media and this has greatly influenced people .
translation.tgt: However , cases of CJD and BSE have been widely documented in the media and this has greatly influenced people .

translation.src: </s> If the media coverage of CJD and BSE continues in the same manner , it is not inconceivable that people in the UK might be so scared that they cease to eat beef entirely .
translation.tgt: If the media coverage of CJD and BSE continues in the same manner , it is not inconceivable that people in the UK might be so scared that they cease to eat beef entirely .

translation.src: </s> If people in the UK were to cease to eat beef , the effect on the agricultural industry would be devestating .
translation.tgt: If people in the UK were to cease to eat beef , the effect on the agricultural industry would be devestating .

translation.src: </s> Cow farmers would fall in numbers by a huge amount .
translation.tgt: Cow farmers would fall in numbers by a huge amount .

translation.src: </s> This is because with the beef market destroyed , the only market open to these farmers would be the dairy products market which is not large enough to sustain many sellers .
translation.tgt: This is because with the beef market destroyed , the only market open to these farmers would be the dairy products market which is not large enough to sustain many sellers .

translation.src: </s> The CJD and BSE scare could even spread to dairy products and if this happened , cow farmers would cease to exist entirely .

translation.src: </s> The question of a single Europe and whether this implies a loss of sovereignty for Britain has been one of considerable debate for some time .
translation.tgt: The question of a single Europe and whether this implies a loss of sovereignty for Britain has been one of considerable debate for some time .

translation.src: </s> Last November , one of the principle reasons underlying Mrs Thatcher 's resignation was her negative stance against increasing involvement in Europe .
translation.tgt: Last November , one of the principle reasons underlying Mrs Thatcher 's resignation was her negative stance against increasing involvement in Europe .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> R: were </s> Her view <extra_id_0> not shared by many of her party colleagues who , on the contrary , were conscious of an all too pressing need for Britain to play an active role in a united Europe .
translation.tgt: Her view were not shared by many of her party colleagues who , on the contrary , were conscious of an all too pressing need for Britain to play an active role in a united Europe .

translation.src: </s> January 1993 is expected to witness the creation of the single European Market .
translation.tgt: January 1993 is expected to witness the creation of the single European Market .

translation.src: </s> The aims of such a union are essentially economic .
translation.tgt: The aims of such a union are essentially economic .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> R: europe </s> All trade barriers will be broken down so as to encourage and promote free trade between the countries of <extra_id_0> , in the belief that increased cooperation will lead to increased productivity .
translation.tgt: All trade barriers will be broken down so as to encourage and promote free trade between the countries of europe , in the belief that increased cooperation will lead to increased productivity .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: many </s> In order to facilitate trade between the different nations <extra_id_0> people are in favour of adopting a common currency , namely the ECU .
translation.tgt: In order to facilitate trade between the different nations many people are in favour of adopting a common currency , namely the ECU .

translation.src: </s> This in turn would also have to lead to the formation of a central European bank .
translation.tgt: This in turn would also have to lead to the formation of a central European bank .

translation.src: </s> A single Europe , whilst primarily being created as an economic union , will necessarily have implications on a political level .
translation.tgt: A single Europe , whilst primarily being created as an economic union , will necessarily have implications on a political level .

translation.src: </s> The European Parliament of course already exists , but many people envisage that in a single Europe it will play a more important role and its power will be extended , possibly surpassing those exercised by individual national governments in Europe and overriding decisions made by them .
translation.tgt: The European Parliament of course already exists , but many people envisage that in a single Europe it will play a more important role and its power will be extended , possibly surpassing those exercised by individual national governments in Europe and overriding decisions made by them .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: the <extra_id_1> R: it </s> For supporters of a single Europe <extra_id_0> question of whether it will entail a loss of British sovereignty is not a primary issue . They would argue first and foremost that Britain can not afford to go <extra_id_1> alone and that it is in her interests to join forces with the rest of Europe .
translation.tgt: For supporters of a single Europe the question of whether it will entail a loss of British sovereignty is not a primary issue . They would argue first and foremost that Britain can not afford to go it alone and that it is in her interests to join forces with the rest of Europe .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: European </s> Critics of <extra_id_0> union , on the other hand , are afraid that increased cooperation in both the economic and political spheres will give rise to a European superpower which will undermine the sovereignty of Britain in these fields .
translation.tgt: Critics of European union , on the other hand , are afraid that increased cooperation in both the economic and political spheres will give rise to a European superpower which will undermine the sovereignty of Britain in these fields .

translation.src: </s> Personally , I am in favour of a single Europe to the extent that I believe Britain can no longer afford to stand alone in opposition to the other countries in Europe , all of which have long been in favour of such a union .
translation.tgt: Personally , I am in favour of a single Europe to the extent that I believe Britain can no longer afford to stand alone in opposition to the other countries in Europe , all of which have long been in favour of such a union .

translation.src: </s> Moreover , closer cooperation will undoubtedly be favourable and bring about increased productivity and prosperity .
translation.tgt: Moreover , closer cooperation will undoubtedly be favourable and bring about increased productivity and prosperity .

translation.src: </s> However , I feel hesitant at the prospect of a common currency , at least until the time when such a move might become necessary , as this would certainly mean the loss of British sovereignty from an economic point of view .
translation.tgt: However , I feel hesitant at the prospect of a common currency , at least until the time when such a move might become necessary , as this would certainly mean the loss of British sovereignty from an economic point of view .

translation.src: </s> Genetic manipulation has been going on for many centuries in the form of selective breeding , both of crops and animals .
translation.tgt: Genetic manipulation has been going on for many centuries in the form of selective breeding , both of crops and animals .

translation.src: </s> This technique has been of great benefit to the human race , enabling the production of more food , better food and new and interesting varieties of food .
translation.tgt: This technique has been of great benefit to the human race , enabling the production of more food , better food and new and interesting varieties of food .

translation.src: </s> Of course , it is not just food that has benefited from selective breeding - the development of different natural fibres such as wool and cotton has been aided by it .
translation.tgt: Of course , it is not just food that has benefited from selective breeding - the development of different natural fibres such as wool and cotton has been aided by it .

translation.src: </s> It is only in very recent times that genetic manipulation has been seen to have bad as well as good sides .
translation.tgt: It is only in very recent times that genetic manipulation has been seen to have bad as well as good sides .

translation.src: </s> This is because we are now at the stage where scientists can alter an organism by changing its genes in some way .
translation.tgt: This is because we are now at the stage where scientists can alter an organism by changing its genes in some way .

translation.src: <extra_id_0> M: can </s> I do not believe that the scientists who originally began research into the nature of genetics had any idea that it would one day be put to bad ( or good ) use - they simply wanted to find out what it was all about , and hence <extra_id_0> not be blamed for any later events .
translation.tgt: I do not believe that the scientists who originally began research into the nature of genetics had any idea that it would one day be put to bad ( or good ) use - they simply wanted to find out what it was all about , and hence can not be blamed for any later events .

translation.src: </s> Today , much research is being carried out on human genes to find out how they work , and whether they can be altered to prevent diseases .
translation.tgt: Today , much research is being carried out on human genes to find out how they work , and whether they can be altered to prevent diseases .

translation.src: </s> Where scientists can be blamed , however , is in the case of genetically engineered tomatoes .
translation.tgt: Where scientists can be blamed , however , is in the case of genetically engineered tomatoes .

translation.src: </s> These are now available in a supermarket near you , with their genes altered to increase their redness , juiciness or resistance to disease .
translation.tgt: These are now available in a supermarket near you , with their genes altered to increase their redness , juiciness or resistance to disease .

translation.src: </s> Similarly , if genetically engineered vaccines or medecines prove to have harmful side - effects , that is because they were not adequately tested before being released into the market , and the scientists are to blame .

translation.src: </s> Terrorism is the use to fear and acts of violence in order to intimidate societies or governments .
translation.tgt: Terrorism is the use to fear and acts of violence in order to intimidate societies or governments .

translation.src: </s> Many different types of social or political organizations might use terrorism to try to achieve their goals .
translation.tgt: Many different types of social or political organizations might use terrorism to try to achieve their goals .

translation.src: </s> It is difficult to define terrorism .
translation.tgt: It is difficult to define terrorism .

translation.src: </s> Terrorism has no official criminal law definition at the international level .
translation.tgt: Terrorism has no official criminal law definition at the international level .

translation.src: </s> Common definitions of terrorism refer to violent acts which are intended to create fear ( terror ) ; are done for a religious , political , or ideological goal ; and which target civilians .
translation.tgt: Common definitions of terrorism refer to violent acts which are intended to create fear ( terror ) ; are done for a religious , political , or ideological goal ; and which target civilians .

translation.src: </s> Some definitions now include acts of unlawful violence and war .
